resources.string: Daily average exchange rates of the Bank of Canada.\nAbout 23 currencies are included.
About 23 exchange rates\nSource: Central Bank of Canada
The rates are published once each business day by 16:30 ET

Exchange rates, as provided by the Russian central bank Bank Rossii. With the current sanctions, this source gives probably the most reliable exchange rates for Russian Ruble.\nBank Rossii lists some 44 exchange rates.
About 44 exchange rates\nSource: Central Bank of Russia
Rates are updated on a daily basis, except on public holidays in Russia.

Exchangerate.host sources the currency rates from various financial data providers and banks, including the European Central Bank. All exchange rate data are delivered in midpoint data. Midpoint rates are determined by calculating the average median rate of Bid and Ask.\nAbout 160 currencies are included.
Exchange rates are updated around midnight UTC every working day.
Fer.ee is a relatively new service, that (just like Frankfurter.app) does track reference exchange (forex) rates that are published by the European Central Bank.\nAbout 30 currencies are included.

Frankfurter.app tracks reference exchange (forex) rates published by the European Central Bank.\nAbout 30 currencies are included.
About 30 exchange rates\nSource: European Central Bank
The data is getting updated around 16:00 CET every working day.

The rates indicated are the market rates for the second to last day of the previous month as quoted by the European Central Bank or, depending on availability, provided by the delegations or other appropriate sources close to that date.
Rates only get updated once a month!
